required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of C-CAR039 in Subjects With Relapsed and/or Refractory B Cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of CD19 and CD20 Targeted Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells Therapy (C-CAR039) in Subjects With Relapsed and/or Refractory B Cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, open-label study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of C-CAR039 in relapsed and/or refractory B cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study includes the following sequential phases: Screening, Apheresis and C-CAR039 manufacturing, Baseline testing, Lymphodepletion, C-CAR039 infusion, Dose-limiting toxicity observation and Follow-up Visit.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 Months. Incidence and severity of adverse events after C-CAR039 infusion according to National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v5.0 criteria, including dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) and laboratory abnormalities.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events after C-CAR039 infusion. Incidence and severity of adverse events according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria, including Dose Limited Toxicity

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration (Cmax) of C-CAR039 in the peripheral blood.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Days 4, 7, 10 and weeks 2, 3, 4, 8, 12 and month 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24
secondary_outcome.description: Detect Chimeric Antigen Receptor-T copies number by quantitative polymerase chain reaction(qPCR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum concentration (Tmax) of C-CAR039 in the peripheral blood.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Days 4, 7, 10 and weeks 2, 3, 4, 8, 12 and month 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24
secondary_outcome.description: Detect Chimeric Antigen Receptor-T copies number by qPCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood duration of C-CAR039 in the peripheral blood after infusion.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Days 4, 7, 10 and weeks 2, 3, 4, 8, 12 and month 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24
secondary_outcome.description: Detect Chimeric Antigen Receptor-T copies number by qPCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve 0h-28d of C-CAR039 in the peripheral blood.
secondary_outcome.description: Detect Chimeric Antigen Receptor-T copies number by qPCR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks, 12 weeks, 6 months, 9 months, 12 months, 15 months, 18 months, 21 months, 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response (CR) rate plus partial response (PR) rate by Lugano 2014 criteria.
The time from the date of first response (PR or better) to the date of disease progression or death after C-CAR039 infusion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks, 12 weeks, 6 months, 9 months, 12 months, 15 months, 18 months, 21 months, 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The time from C-CAR039 infusion to the date of progression as assessed by Lugano 2014 criteria or death.
The time from C-CAR039 infusion to the date of death.

arm_group.description: Autologous C-CAR039 administered by intravenous (IV) infusion

intervention.intervention_name: CD19/CD20-directed Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells
intervention.description: Autologous 2nd generation CD19/CD20-directed Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells, single infusion intravenously

clinical_study.keyword: CD19/CD20-directed Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells
